lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Nary.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Nary.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Main class for the Nary chatbot application.
* Handles user input, task management, and storage operations.
private static final Storage storage = new Storage("data/nary.txt");
private static final Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
* Handles user input and executes the corresponding commands.
throw new NaryException("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new NaryException("OOPS!!! The description or deadline date cannot be empty.");
throw new NaryException("OOPS!!! Event must have from and to dates.");
throw new NaryException("OOPS!!! Event must have both start and end dates.");
addTask(new Event(parts1[0].trim(), parts2[0].trim(), parts2[1].trim())); // expects yyyy-MM-dd
throw new NaryException("OOPS!!! The keyword to find cannot be empty.");
throw new NaryException("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
/** Saves current task list to storage. */
* Adds a task to the task list and saves it.
* Prints a message indicating the task was added.
* @param t The task that was added
System.out.println(" Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
/** Prints all tasks in the task list. */
System.out.println(" Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Marks a task as done based on user input.
* @param input The user input containing the index to mark
System.out.println(" Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println(" Invalid index for mark command!");
* Marks a task as not done based on user input.
* @param input The user input containing the index to unmark
System.out.println(" OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println(" Invalid index for unmark command!");
* Deletes a task based on user input.
* @param input The user input containing the index to delete
System.out.println(" Invalid command, please provide index to delete.");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println(" That isn't a valid number to delete.");
* Finds tasks containing the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for
System.out.println(" Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents custom exceptions specific to the Nary chatbot.
* Used to indicate invalid commands or input errors encountered during execution.
* Constructs a new {@code NaryException} with the specified detail message.
* Handles loading and saving tasks to a file.
* Provides persistence for the Nary chatbot.
* Creates a Storage instance that will read/write data to the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path of the file to store tasks.
* @return A list of tasks read from the file. Returns an empty list if no file exists.
Task event = new Event(parts[2], parts[3], parts[4]);
* Saves the given list of tasks to the file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Inherits from {@link Task} and includes a due date.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and due date.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The deadline in yyyy-MM-dd format.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task,
* including its due date formatted as "MMM d yyyy".
* @return A string describing the deadline task.
* Represents an Event task that has a start and end date.
* Constructs an Event with description, start date, and end date.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from Start date in yyyy-MM-dd format.
* @param to End date in yyyy-MM-dd format.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event,
* including the start and end dates formatted as "MMM d yyyy".
* @return String representation of the event task.
DateTimeFormatter fmt = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy", Locale.ENGLISH);
* Represents a general task in the Nary chatbot.
* A task has a description and can be marked as done or not done.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise a blank space.
/** Marks this task as not done. */
/** @return A string representation of the task. */
* Represents a Todo task (without a date).
* Constructs a Todo with the given description.
* @param description The description of the todo task.
/** Returns a string representation of the Todo task. */
What can I do for you?
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Here are the tasks in your list:

OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
